Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2012 09:22PM Kitteneclair wrote: Thank you for the perspective, Nancy - as a fellow runner, I mean it when I say I am so glad to hear you are back out there - one of the things that scares me most about treatment is the idea that I won't be able to run through it (tho I'll try!) I'll use your advice to trust my gut.
Posts.Title: Choosing Between TC and AC-T Kitteneclair Elizabeth1889

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2012 04:39PM Kitteneclair wrote: Thanks Kam170 - "stay moving as much as you can" seems to be the consensus amongst all the doctors I have consulted with so far. And I am a kale believer - I try to have leafy greens at least once every day, and am trying now to focus how much better off I am for it. Keep walking and best of luck!
Posts.Title: Choosing Between TC and AC-T Kitteneclair Elizabeth1889

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2012 09:20PM Kitteneclair wrote: Thank you for your wishes, toomuch, as well as your experience. No oncotype test yet, though after reading the boards over the past couple of days and your comment today, I'm hoping that the MO I'm planning on working with will agree to submit a sample for a test and let it guide my choice. Sound advice.
